title: 30 Healthy Snacks For On-the-go
summary: Greek yogurt with berries and granola is one of the healthiest and tastiest ways to start your day. Rice cakes with hummus paired with rice cakes are a fantastic alternative to crackers, chips, and other carb-heavy snacks. Whole grain crackers with cheese crackers are a great choice for when you have the time to sit down and eat. Japanese people are sometimes seen as having a healthy diet, but that's not the entire story. The Japanese diet has traditionally included a high consumption of fish and a wide range of vegetables.

intro.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,"You\u2019ve probably heard it before: When you\u2019re busy, you need healthy snacks to keep you going. The problem is that it\u2019s not always easy to find healthy snacks that are also fast and convenient. In our hectic, on-the-go world, most of us don\u2019t have time to sit down for a healthy meal three times a day. Instead, we\u2019re often forced to make snap decisions about what we can eat quickly and conveniently. Unfortunately, those decisions too often lead to less than healthy snack options like potato chips or sweets. However, there are plenty of great ways to get your recommended daily intake of fruits and veggies even when you\u2019re on the go. These 30 healthy snacks for on-the-go are perfect for keeping in your purse, desk drawer, locker, or anywhere else you might find yourself hungry and without access to a full meal."))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

content.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...a}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...a,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("h2",null,"Greek yogurt with berries and granola"),mdx("p",null,"This is one of the healthiest and tastiest ways to start your day. It\u2019s loaded with protein to keep you feeling full longer and it\u2019s packed with vitamins, minerals, and other nutrients. By buying the plain, non-fat Greek yogurt, you can save calories and fat compared with the flavored varieties. Plus, you can add fresh berries, granola for crunch, and a drizzle of honey for sweetness. The Greek yogurt will also help to keep the granola from getting soggy, as it doesn\u2019t require any milk or yogurt."),mdx("p",null,"This is also a good make-ahead option. Prepare the yogurt, granola, and berries in separate containers and then just combine them right before eating. You can even put everything into a plastic bag to make it easy to transport."),mdx("h2",null,"Rice cakes with hummus"),mdx("p",null,"Rice cakes are a fantastic alternative to crackers, chips, and other carb-heavy snacks. They\u2019re light and crispy and they taste great with any number of topping options. You can also find them in a number of different flavors and even in savory varieties, which are especially good with hummus. Hummus makes for a great healthy snack on its own, but it\u2019s even better paired with rice cakes."),mdx("p",null,"You can buy rice cakes in bulk and keep a supply on hand for whenever you\u2019re hungry. They\u2019re also a great option for kids\u2019 lunch boxes because they don\u2019t get soggy or crumbly like crackers do."),mdx("h2",null,"Veggie sticks and hummus"),mdx("p",null,"Hummus is a great choice for veggie sticks because it\u2019s rich in protein and other nutrients while being low in calories\u2014plus it tastes great on veggies. You can buy hummus in a variety of flavors, including garlic, roasted red pepper, and lemon. Use veggie sticks with the skin on to get more fiber and vitamins."),mdx("p",null,"If you\u2019re buying ready-made veggie sticks, make sure to read the label to make sure they\u2019re not heavily salted or otherwise processed. It\u2019s better to buy fresh vegetables and cut them up yourself. You can use a vegetable peeler to make the process quick and easy."),mdx("h2",null,"Fruit and yogurt parfait"),mdx("p",null,"A classic parfait made from yogurt, granola, and fresh fruit is a great way to start the day or to kill the afternoon hunger pangs. You can buy granola in bulk and make sure it has no added sugar or other unnecessary ingredients. You can also make your own granola at home."),mdx("p",null,"When buying yogurt, make sure to choose a brand that has no added sugar and uses whole milk, as opposed to low-fat or non-fat milk. You\u2019ll get more nutrients that way. Plus, yogurt is a great source of probiotics, which can help improve digestion."),mdx("h2",null,"Whole grain crackers with cheese"),mdx("p",null,"A healthy snack doesn\u2019t have to be all about quick and easy. Sometimes, you just have to take the time to sit down at a table to eat. Cheese crackers are a great choice for when you have the time to sit down and eat. These are light and easy to transport, so you can easily bring them to work, school, or anywhere else where you\u2019re in a snack-friendly environment."),mdx("p",null,"Try to find crackers that have low sodium, low fat, and no preservatives. You can also make your own cheese crackers at home by topping cracker squares with a mixture of cheese and spices. This is also a great way to use up extra cheese that\u2019s past its best-by date."),mdx("h2",null,"Kashi Golean"),mdx("p",null,"Golbal and regional diets are always being studied, questioned and adjusted and this is particularly true of the Japanese diet. In the West, Japanese people are sometimes seen as having a healthy diet, but that's not the entire story. In fact, the Japanese diet has traditionally included a high consumption of fish and a wide range of vegetables."),mdx("p",null,"Golbal and regional diets are always being studied, questioned and adjusted and this is particularly true of the Japanese diet. In the West, Japanese people are sometimes seen as having a healthy diet, but that's not the entire story. In fact, the Japanese diet has traditionally included a high consumption of fish and a wide range of vegetables."),mdx("p",null,"A lesser known but fascinating aspect of the Japanese diet is that it often includes seaweed. While this might sound strange to many people outside Japan, seaweed is actually an important part of the traditional diet there. In fact, it accounts for around 20% of the calories in the diet."),mdx("h2",null,"Frozen fruit smoothie maker"),mdx("p",null,"Frozen fruit smoothies are a fantastic choice for when you need a quick snack. They\u2019re easy to make at home but they\u2019re also available to purchase premade in many stores. They\u2019re great because they\u2019re refreshing and they\u2019re also packed with vitamins, minerals, and other nutrients."),mdx("p",null,"These smoothies are usually made with yogurt as a base, so they\u2019re a good source of protein and calcium. They\u2019re also usually sweetened with either sugar or artificial sweeteners. If you want to make them healthier, try adding fresh or frozen fruit and water instead. You can also add protein powder if you want a more substantial snack."),mdx("h2",null,"Individual serving oatmeal packets"),mdx("p",null,"Oatmeal is one of the healthiest and most filling breakfast options. Unfortunately, it\u2019s also one of the messiest. Squeezing it into a bowl and trying to eat it from there is messy, difficult, and can be less than satisfying. Instead of making a mess, get individual packets of oatmeal. They\u2019re easy to make and you can quickly and easily pour them into a bowl or cup to eat."),mdx("p",null,"Make sure to check the ingredients on the oatmeal packet to make sure that there are no preservatives or other unnecessary additives. You can also sweeten the oatmeal with honey or other natural sweeteners."),mdx("h2",null,"Cheese stick and string bean combo"),mdx("p",null,"These two healthy snacks are great together. Cheese is a wonderful snack because it\u2019s full of protein and calcium. You can also choose between different types of cheese and mix up your selections, so they don\u2019t get boring. String beans are a great vegetable because they\u2019re very low in calories, but they\u2019re also high in fiber."),mdx("p",null,"This combination is simple because you can eat the string beans and cheese as is. You can also dip the cheese in the beans, or you can wrap the string beans around the cheese and eat them together."),mdx("h2",null,"Conclusion"),mdx("p",null,"These 30 healthy snacks for on-the-go will help you stay healthy and satisfied. They\u2019re all easy to prepare or purchase premade and they\u2019re all packed with vitamins, minerals, and other nutrients. Whether you\u2019re trying to lose weight or just eating healthy, these snacks are a great way to stay satisfied while also getting the nutrients you need."))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: 10 Ways to Make Your Commute Less Stressful

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`When you think about your daily commute, it probably doesn\u2019t strike you as being particularly stressful. In fact, many people see their daily drive to work or school as a time for peace and quiet. After all, what could possibly be stressful about getting from point A to point B?
It\u2019s true that your commute isn\u2019t inherently stressful. In theory, it\u2019s just a short period of time each day when you go from home to work (or vise versa). But even the most seemingly insignificant details can make a big difference. Read on to learn more about how you can reduce stress during your commute and get to work happier every day!`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: 7 Exercises to Lose Weight in 7 Days

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`The beginning of the New Year is a perfect time to focus on healthy habits and get off to a great start. With a strict diet, you will be able to burn fat effectively and efficiently, leading to weight loss in just a week. Exercising regularly not only helps you lose weight but also promotes long-term weight loss by increasing your metabolic rate and maintaining lean body mass.
Reducing fat from the body requires breaking down of fats in the body through physical activities. There are undoubtedly many reasons why people fail at losing weight, but most of them boil down to three simple things: lack of time, motivation, or knowledge. Fortunately, with these simple tricks you can lose weight in 7 days:`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: 10 Tips for Keeping Your Hair Healthy and Strong

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Keeping your hair healthy can be a challenge at times, but it's important to keep on top of things in order to prevent any further damage. Whether you have fine and sensitive locks or thick and curly tresses, the right routine will help keep your hair strong and prevent it from breaking under pressure. Keeping your hair strong is an ongoing process, but by adopting some simple tips you can make things much easier on your locks long term.
Learn how to avoid over-washing, what products are best for stronger hair, as well as what you should be doing if you see strands falling out more than normal. The latter might seem strange, but trust us: sooner rather than later that excess hair loss could indicate something more serious happening beneath the surface. Here are 10 ways to keep your hair healthy and strong...`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Make Time for Self-Care When You're Busy
How to Get Your Kids to Eat More Vegetables
10 Tips for Getting a Good Night's Sleep
The Best Healthy Breakfast Recipes to Start Your Day

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`With so many people operating on tight schedules, the majority of us skip breakfast. If you find yourself falling into this category, you\u2019re not alone. In fact, skipping meals is one of the most common diet pitfalls. Skipping a meal or two can lead to an increase in your blood sugar and make it more difficult to lose weight.
Incorporating healthy breakfasts every day will help keep your metabolism running more efficiently and reduce cravings later on in the day. High-protein breakfasts are especially helpful if you\u2019re trying to lose weight or build muscle. Here are some great ideas for incorporating healthy breakfasts into your regular routine.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Get Moving When You Don't Have Time for the Gym

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`New Year, same old resolutions. If you\u2019re anything like the majority of people, chances are that you have made the same resolution to get fitter, healthier and happier this year as you did last year. But with a packed work schedule, social calendar and everything else going on in your life it can be difficult to find time to hit the gym or take up that new Zumba class you signed up for last October but never went to again.
And yet so many of us do manage to get moving. Yes, it might involve setting your alarm an hour earlier than usual, waking up on Saturday morning instead of Friday night and putting in some serious dedication \u2014 but it is possible. So if you\u2019re struggling to find time for the gym here are some creative ways how you can get moving when you don\u2019t have time for the gym:`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Make Time for Yourself When You Have a Busy Schedule

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Are you someone who is known to be a selfless person? Do you often place the needs of others before your own? If so, you\u2019re definitely an amazing person. However, when it comes to your social life and personal interests, do those aspects take a backseat most of the time? Whether you come from a hectic work schedule or have other obligations that require your attention most of the time, being busy all the time can completely suck the life out of you.
If that sounds like you, don\u2019t worry! You aren\u2019t alone. Many people today find it difficult to carve out some time for themselves. Thankfully, it is possible to balance a busy schedule and make time for yourself. Here are some helpful suggestions on how you can make time for yourself even when you feel like there isn\u2019t any left in the world.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Make Healthy Eating Easier with Meal Planning

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Thinking about meal planning sounds like more trouble than it\u2019s worth. And for many people, it feels that way. We all lead such busy lives and between work, school, family obligations, and social activities, it can feel like there\u2019s not enough hours in the day to squeeze in planning and prepping meals.
We can all agree that eating well is essential to living a healthy life. But sticking to healthy eating habits can be challenging and require some serious willpower. Even if you\u2019re committed to good nutrition, finding the time and energy to shop for fresh ingredients, prep them for the week, and reheat them throughout the week is exhausting just thinking about it! Fortunately, there are several sneaky strategies you can use to make healthy eating easier.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;
